website_summaries.verdict: A good, midsize cordless that won’t break the bank.
pros: We love the 4 yr. warranty that comes with this model
This model will continue to perform over time with proper care and maintenance as well
Put to use in a mere 10 min
cons: Modest performance, particularly in thick grass

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t receive the advertised battery.  Got a 2ah instead of a 4ah.
customer_reviews.text: I was supposed to receive a g max 40V 4.0ah battery with this mower but it came with a 2ah battery. I didn t notice it until a week after I bought it and used it so I can t return. Basically I didn t get what I paid for since the 4ah is more expensive. I am now getting less run time for what I paid for. Very disappointing. I purchased the the blower /trimmer combo a week later and received the incorrect battery in it also. I ve looked everywhere for the battery I received and can t even match the part number. I would be careful of checking that you are receiving what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: DDS

customer_reviews.title: Battery
customer_reviews.text: We have had this mower for less than a year and the battery already won't hold a charge. We bought it at the end of October and have probably used it twice a month since Feburary and now the battery isn't holding a charge. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Casey White

customer_reviews.title: Can't get very far
customer_reviews.text: We love the idea of this mower but in real life it is awful. Our backyard is pretty tiny. About 1/4 of an acre. Yet this thing can't get through a third or less of it before dying. My fiance had to charge it FOUR times to do our little backyard. This mower is so nice and lightweight. Easy to push. And cuts well. Plus it's super quiet. Unfortunately the terrible battery ruins it. It has great potential but can't be utilized properly due to that huge flaw. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Sarikitten

customer_reviews.title: Used it 4 times and it broke.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the end of last summer after purchasing a new home and finally having to cut the grass. Was easy to put together, and worked well for the 3-4 times I used it. Pulled it out of the garage recently to use at the start of this year and it no longer works. Have followed multiple DIY videos of how to fix it to no avail. What a waste of money. Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Mower works great,but came without the battery and the charger. Had to wait over two weeks until Greenworks sent them. Mower is very easy to maneuver around flower beds and other plantings. Has plenty of power. Our lot is 1/4 acre and hilly. It takes two battery charges to mow completely.
customer_reviews.author: Jane E McAndrew

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes but should have been more careful. Even after charging for over a day the battery runs the little mower only long enough to get a small part of my tiny front yard cut. It has taken most of a week to charge, mow a bit, the recharge the battery. Now I must get a better machine and sell this one at a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: JFSea

customer_reviews.title: Weak mower and battery, possible faulty charger
customer_reviews.text: It took three charges to mow my average sized front lawn. And when it does run, it stalls out on a small amount of weeds/grass. It needs to come with more batteries and it needs to be more powerful. I regret the $300 I spent on it. Edit: The charger is indicating that the charging is complete, but the battery is dead. The meter attached to the battery displays zero bars, and the mower won't work, so I'm SOL. It'd be nice if they provided two batteries so I could troubleshoot to find out if it was the battery or charger.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary R

customer_reviews.title: Powerful enough for the Pacific Northwest
customer_reviews.text: This lightweight mower is easy maneuver in the tight areas around my new blueberry bushes and ferns and can handle the wet grass after an early morning rain. I was able to mow the front, side, and both levels of the back yard with one charge. As you can see from the two full cans of cuttings the grass was pretty tall before I got started. The front yard was mowed at level 2, 1 being the shortest, and the back and side was mowed at level 5, 7 being the highest. Its an amazing little mower. Beats the heck out of the Black and Decker I had with the extremely heavy battery.
customer_reviews.author: fkey541

customer_reviews.title: Better have a tiny yard, and don't let the grass grow past a week.
customer_reviews.text: You'll see in the picture i maintain our kids play area, or try. I thought, let's stay away from gas and go green and easy. I have to use 3 batteries to mow, and weed eat this area! The mower stalls as it collects grass, even with the bag attached. So, clean out the bottom, get to mowing again, only to have to do that every 20 feet!! This is the most infuriating item I've purchased from amazon! I guess I was just naive in thinking this would serve my needs. The picture shows the fenced in area I try to mow, 1800 square feet. Wish I was able to return the mower, 2 batteries, and weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Torres

customer_reviews.title: Cuts as good as a gas mower - but you'll want an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: Functionally, this thing runs and cuts as good as any gas mower I've ever used. I don't see any reduction in the "power" you'd expect from a gas engine, so that's good. Thing is, I have what I'd call a small-to-medium front/back lawn to mow & I can juuust barely get through on a single battery. I'd say I get about 40-50min of cutting from the battery that ships with the mower. I ordered a spare battery I can use to swap-in if needed, or to run the edger after mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Double-D

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Cut and Excessive Batter Usage
customer_reviews.text: The mower is very light weight and the battery is easy to remove and reinstall. The batter needs to be replaced and recharge for each cut of a 6000 SQ. FT lawn. I have two batteries for other devices, but need both to completely mow the lawn. The other main issue is the mower cuts the lawn unevenly. Several passes are required to have an even cut. Knowing these two issue, I would've passed on this lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: Randy S. in SA

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I read somewhere that the battery can last up to one hour or about 7,000 sq. my yard is about 6,000sq and I have to charge it twice to cut the grass. The battery drains in about 20 minutes! and I have to charge it again for couple of hours to do the rest of my yard. so disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Khezri

customer_reviews.title: Made the switch to electric
customer_reviews.text: I was due for a new mower but I have sever RA and the pulling was becoming a problem with the gas mowers to start and they are heavy. This mower works wonderful folds flat and cuts and mulches great. It is easy to use. The only draw back I have had is with the battery lasting long enough I can't even get my front yard done and I have to charge it. I will probably buy another battery so I don't have to stop and wait for it to charge. Other than that I have no complaints yet but I have only cut the lawn about 6 times so far.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: GreenDoesntWork
customer_reviews.text: Product was not as light as they claimed it should be, I was having difficulty moving the mower across my yard and it would turn off frequently... And before I could finish my "small" yard it stopped working. I checked to see if battery was the issue, and it was fully charged according to the charger... The little button on the battery that shows the charge though doesn't seem to work.. Whether it's the battery's fault or something else, it made a bad impression. Returning this product ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Look for a different lawnmower. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: We followed the instructions. The fully charged battery died less than halfway through mowing our small front lawn. What it did mow looks very uneven. It's difficult to maneuver and the results are terrible. We're left with a half mowed lawn and a dead battery. This is going right back. Really not happy.
customer_reviews.author: VA86

customer_reviews.title: Great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: The lawnmower works very well but the battery or the charger has some issues and now, after only four months, it is useless. The charger won't charge the battery and it will remain with only a red light forever. I wrote to the customer service a few days ago but no answer. By now I can only give them 2 stars, and that's because it performed very well when it worked, otherwise I'll give them only one star. Hopefully the customer service can send me a replacement battery or charger before my yard becomes a jungle.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT Buy this product ! Out of the box the battery did not work, and after a lengthy time with customer service I was eventually able to to get a new battery at Lowe's. After maybe 8 mowings of a fairly small lawn, the mower does not work. 30 min waiting with customer service for them to tell me take it to a location to be repaired - a 50 mile roundtrip I will have to do twice, in a pandemic no less. I won't do it for this piece of junk. My gas Toro mower worked flawlessly for 16 years. Go with Toro ...or really any lawn-mower manufacturer but Green works.
customer_reviews.author: ken schmidt

customer_reviews.title: The worst
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awful. Choked up on short lawn easily, and something was wrong with the battery. I had to return it immediately. It is possible that that I just got a bad mower.. but to be safe I'll never go with this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: BOSJO DODRU

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: While I will never love mowing the lawn, this makes it feel like much less of a chore. I was surprised at how lightweight it is, and the maneuverability is excellent . I kind of miss some of the momentum that my old, heavy, clunky mower provided, but there is no reduction in performance at all with this one. It cuts well, even through lush spring growth like we've had the past few weeks. The battery lasts through mowing the whole yard--we're on a 1/3 acre lot. And it is noticeably quieter than the old one. Easy to assemble, easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Bob

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised
customer_reviews.text: The mower arrived as promised and it was easy to assemble. The battery needs to be charged before starting and it takes about two hours each time. I was very happy to see that I could mow a 1/2 acre without a recharge. The mower seemed to be all plastic unlike any mower I owned before, but it's pretty though! I have always used a John Deere mower but this mower vacuumed up leaves better, and simple to change leaf bags.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: great mower
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how much I like this mower. I bought it for my front yard as it is difficult to impossible with my riding mower due to hillside and lots sharp curves. This mower is easy to handle, cuts very well, quiet and I am surprised how much I can cut on one charge with only a 17 inch mower. It bags the clippings very well and is easy to disconnect and reconnect each time. Storage is great as the handle has quick release to fold in half and whole mower can be stored tipped at 90 degrees for space saving.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fifteen Minutes From Unboxing to Mowing
customer_reviews.text: Quick assembly and since I'd charged the battery up that morning it was good to go. Mows nicely and is quiet enough that you can listen to music or podcasts. The grass catcher is a small, but does the job. I had tall, thick, wettish grass in back and the mower handled it well. It will choke if you push it too fast through really thick stuff, so I took it nice and slow. The yard is about 1/2 an acre and should now only take on charge to cut...unless I get lazy and let it grow out again.
customer_reviews.author: Outskiing

customer_reviews.title: The battery kills this deal
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lawnmower, other than the fact that the battery is terrible! It takes a full 6 hours to charge, and runs for a half an hour. Do you want to cut your lawn for half an hour and then have to wait 6 hours to finish it? I don't.
customer_reviews.author: Helaine O Newman

customer_reviews.title: Received a defective battery, will let you know how customer service is soon.
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE Customer service responded and explained that the battery must be allowed to cool down before charging. Otherwise, the charger will read the battery as fully charged. I do believe this is what was happening. The battery does seem to weaken by the time I finish my yard and I have less than a tenth of an acre. Most users will probably need multiple batteries. ******* I had a corded Black and Decker but hated the cords. I "upgraded" to this. Second time using it, the battery died and won't recharge. I just contacted customer service and will update my review once I see how they handle my claim.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Man

customer_reviews.title: User friendly lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower works well for me. And I’m older and not particularly strong. I have little experience putting things together or mowing a lawn. I did read the directions but this is a simple assembly. The mower is quiet (like a room air conditioner). I wanted something I could pick up and push with relative ease. The battery lasted an hour but ran out before I finished cutting the very high grass in my small yard. I took a 30 minute break to partially charge the battery and finished the lawn. I’m sure the battery will last through a regular mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Little monster truck that eats everything
customer_reviews.text: This has been an insane monster truck which chops everything it sees. Very powerful and does the job in one go for my backyard. My backyard is about 3000 sqft. The only weird thing was, I kept the battery in the mower and next day morning, the battery was dead. Why would there be a battery consumption when it’s turned off. Don’t get the logic.
customer_reviews.author: Rajshekar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mower for price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mower for the price. This was my first battery operated mower & it exceeded my expectations. I can mow front and back 2 times on 1 charge. READ the battery instructions. I had read a couple bad reviews in ref to battery life. You have to fully charge prior to use. When done mowing remove the battery. Do not recharge until it dies. This is every time. I tried to attach 2 photos to show my yards size. Backyard is same size as front. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Great green choice
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy set up, battery holds charge for mowing about .75 acres. Only drawback is the mower has no turning radius. I literally have to lift up the back wheels and turn. Not a huge deal since the mower is fairly lightweight for its size. I might have missed it in the description that the wheels don't turn. Since this mower is battery powered my kids have helped out with mowing! Push a button and pull up on the handle and mow! Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: andrea Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Quite and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a mower battery powered, low price. This one gets the job done mowed front, back, and both sides and still had a good charge left. Had lots of cutting power even over the weeds that grow out like vines. I use the mulching plug, hate emptying bags. I keep the battery inside the house to preserve it, and the mower in the shed.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald B.

customer_reviews.title: Missing & Damaged Parts
customer_reviews.text: Opened the brand new box yesterday and noticed I was missing parts! The 2 clamps to hold together the arms and the mulching plug are missing and 1 of the clamps to hold the arm to the body is broken. The box arrived new and undamaged. So, I'm left to believe this happened upon original packaging. Really disappointed that I had to call a lawn company out and need to order parts to use my new mower.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy J Schrack

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery performance
customer_reviews.text: I received this product last month and initially when battery was put on charging, it was flashing red that shows some issues there but after sometime, it started charging. After full charging, I was able to use this for 15 minutes and it was discharged. I tried again 2 times but it lasts only for 15-20 minutes. Called up customer service many times and it seems the support line is always busy. I thought to return this product but Amazon Customer service was able to provide a replacement battery which is 2.5 Ah but not the one that comes with mower. Still need to order.
customer_reviews.author: AK82

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product because it was lightweight and battery powered. Used it three times on a lawn that is not huge and it stopped working and would not start again. Very cheaply made. Mowing height adjustment mechanism is ridiculous. Hopelessly bad manual -- B&W line drawings so small, it is sometimes impossible to make out what is being shown. I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Good mower
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Easy to move around and catches grass very well. The starting up function takes some getting used to. Once it gets cutting, it cuts well and is no problem. Recharges quickly and lasts a reasonable amount of time before it needs another recharge. Great for a smaller lawn. Runs quieter than a gas mower and FAR more convenient than an electric (with cord) mower.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Brower

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This product is what they promote in their page and pics. It's awesome convenient. Sturdy and durable. The performance was amazing considering I've 0.5 acre it lasted for quite a bit before getting discharged. Battery has it's cons and pros however this is a great product for a regular home with normal yard, otherwise I'll be getting the bigger version of this.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t turn very easy, it also struggles when the grass get a little long. I am ok with this purchase as I am a single mom that hates yard work so I needed something with a battery so I could just do it when I have time and not have to worry about getting gas. It does its job, even though I would consider my yard pretty flat is has a hard time going over the bumps I do have.
customer_reviews.author: Taneisha gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased last week - really happy so far! My husband is used to gas-powered mowers and said he was impressed with how light and easy to push it was. Cut the grass and weeds great. Our yard is fairly large and took a over an hour to mow everything, so we might end up ordering an extra battery. We had a lot of weeds so the battery only lasted about 50 minutes. It was really easy to assemble and get started. I was surprised how quiet it is. I can’t even hear the mower from inside our house.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Regret purchasing to the MAX
customer_reviews.text: Such, such a huge disappointment. It took my husband all day to get half the lawn mowed due to the blade getting jammed and the battery dying. It comes with two batteries, we’ve had to charge both atleast 3 times in just one passing. Easy to ensemble but I regret just saving up more for a fancier one. This is was complete miss.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy electric.
customer_reviews.text: It's light and easy to move around. The bag that catches and fills quickly so I'm often dumping the bag out. This isn't a problem because of how easy it is to start and stop this mower. It's quiet enough that you can actually hear people around you if they need to talk to you or get your attention. The battery that comes with is enough to get around our front and backyard (roughly 2000 sq ft), but the battery often runs out before I can finish the boulevard and the strip between our house and the neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Frank

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Mower is constantly dying - can barely handle even a small yard with grass that was mowed the week before. I wish I could get my money back. Be wary of this product - it isn't worth the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Anon ymous

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so this is a big step up for me. The mower has lots of power for a small lawn as long as you keep it charged. Does a bit of a hack job on the lawn, but good enough. Mulches well. Easy to breakdown and store with leavers that lock and unlock the folding push-handle. Of a size that most will be able to easily pick up and move. Not good at edge work. In general, it gets my seal of approval and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B.

customer_reviews.title: Does a poor job
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty small lawn. It takes me about 90 minutes to mow, edge, trim, and blow the clippings. Unfortunately, that time includes having to go over parts of it twice because it looks bad after the first time. Also, even though my lawn is pretty small, I can't make it around on once charge. (It's about 10 minutes short of that.) It IS convenient.
customer_reviews.author: David Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: My old 8.5 year mower bit the dust. It was a 36v powered one. You can see the advance in battery technology to the Greenworks 40v. I get about 28 minutes on #2 cut setting, which means I can cut 70% of my lawn. That's about the same as my old mower. Wait an hour to get half a charge and it's enough to finish the rest. Grass doesn't stick to the Bottom and the 17" let me get into the narrow areas easily. Plus it folds away for winter storage quickly. I'm retired, so cutting the lawn in 2 go's isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mower
customer_reviews.text: I used this yesterday for the first time. It is super easy to assemble an performed well. My grass had gotten tall & thick in spots, not to mention a bit damp near the ground in the taller spots. I was impressed at how easily this mower went through those areas.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Great mower.
customer_reviews.text: I was alittle reluctant to purchase this mower as I have a larger yard. It has surpassed my expectations. I have to mow in sections, but in Florida that's not a bad thing. Love how easy it start and maneuvers around everything.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Breighner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect battery mower
customer_reviews.text: I was in great doubt about a battery powered mower. But to my worries, this mower is absolutely great. It cuts at the levels you set, push button start, very lightweight, and best part no gas or oil. Very fast shipping .....Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Great little mower and I like it a lot. I am certainly satisfied with it But it does feel kind of like a toy. I imagine it could break easily with so much plastic on the body of the mower. The collection bag on the back is tiny.... not really a problem for my postage stamp lawn, but it would be annoying to those with average sized lawns. Make sure you don’t leave the battery charging after it is full of charge ( it charges fully in about 1-2 hours) in order to keep it charging properly in the future.
customer_reviews.author: julia k kulkarni

customer_reviews.title: First Electric Mower!
customer_reviews.text: This is our first electric mower and it is great after the first cut! You can easily adjust the height you are cutting at. We got over an hour per charge when we used it. You only have to assemble the push bar, and that was pretty straight forward. It is very quite compared to gas mowers, going to miss annoying the neighbors. haha.
customer_reviews.author: Thumper

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This mower works great for my medium sized yard. Its maneuverable, can get in close to the fence line and is just the right size to not take up a lot of space in the shed. I've had no issues with the battery life so far and the charging is reasonably quick when I want to go and mow the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Dude Guy GO

customer_reviews.title: A Mighty Mower!
customer_reviews.text: We love our battery powered mower! Perfect for the lanes in our garden and around the outside of the fence. I also use it to touch up after my husband uses the riding mower on the yard. A great mower! Very light. But powerful!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Suddenly Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the mower a few times (maybe 3 or 4?) since I purchased it earlier this year and it suddenly stopped working. It won’t turn on at all and I have checked — there is nothing wrong with the battery and the mower is not clogged. I am super disappointed because now my front lawn is half-mowed and TBH it’s kind of embarrassing. I have contacted the company. I will update my review if and when I hear back from them, but you would expect a mower to work more than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for near the house
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a trim and mowing around the house, especially when you don't want to mess with the gas and oil of your big mower. Not for substantial spaces due to 17 in blade width, but when the 60 in riding mower won't do, this certainly will
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P. McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Hocus Pocus
customer_reviews.text: The idea of an electric lawn mower is great, but we were not able to finish our lawn the first time. I called the help line, only to be told that I am number 100 in queue. Waiting for about 1 hour and 20 to talk to an agent, who put me on hold and finally dropped me after waiting for 1 hour and 40 minutes! I am not happy
customer_reviews.author: Tony vonArx

customer_reviews.title: To hard to push.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like it. It's not good for elderly who can't push to hard.
customer_reviews.author: Massimina Dobias

customer_reviews.title: Mower too awesome for 1 sentence
customer_reviews.text: My old black n decker mower with a 30lb battery was on the outs.. having a bad back I dreaded lugging that battery... This green works mower was easy to assemble. Maybe 5 minutes.. I can hold the battery in one hand easily! 1 charge did my whole, thick, clumpy, obnoxious yard!! But this mower cut thru it like buttah... The whole mower is super super lite and easy to maneuver!! Even for my bad back!! This is a God send!!!
customer_reviews.author: danielle j.

customer_reviews.title: EZ mowing for small areas
customer_reviews.text: I like it; the ad says one could mow a larger area than I can. After 3200 sq feet, the battery is on 1/4 and after 3800 sq ft the battery is out of charge. It charges quickly, it's quiet, my neighbors stare at it, I don't have gas cans in my garage anymore. So, use it until the battery is at 0%, recharge then keep on mowing.
customer_reviews.author: Scubated

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have ever made. Easy to start, cuts beautifully, lightweight. People often stop to ask me how I like it. I always recommend it to everyone. My son has gas powered mowers but he borrows mine because of the convenience. No gas or oil to buy. No spark plugs to replace. It’s a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C. Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Great lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: I was not expecting much from a battery powered mower. However, this mower works perfectly Easy to assemble, easy top use, very lightweight. Battery works for a very long time, plenty of time to mow front and back and juice leftover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I made to get this
customer_reviews.text: It's simply amazing. It takes the pain out of mowing. Just get another battery other than that this thing beats a gas powered one...my grass comes out with a better cut in half the amount of time and half the amount of energy to do it! Money well spent!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Battery lifespan questionable
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mower. It is quiet and fairly maneuverable. It takes about 30min to cut my lawn. I can't get two cuts out of one battery charge though. I hope that doesn't get worse. The battery is fairly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: with the mulcher, the battery lasted 45min. without just with bucket 2h. I bought an additional battery and can do the whole yard. light, easy, comfortable. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AZM

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet, it doesn't weigh a ton,it doesn't stink, I don't have to play with gas or pull a string to start it and it did my badly overgrown lawn on a single charge. I have short grass not a straggly hay field - I'm happy. I've now used this little gem several times, the last time on longish (9 inch) thick wet grass. Finished the mow with charge left in the battery! I LOVE this mower!!!
customer_reviews.author: assegai

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a battery powered mower. Overall it a great machine but I had to adjust to it. Its easy to use and requires less effort to push. I'm 6'6" and I'm able to stand upright making it easier on my back. Needed to buy a spare battery due to the size of my yard but that's okay because I plan to buy another tool in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: 1/4 Acre per charge
customer_reviews.text: Cutting through tough grass quietly and effortlessly this machine provides a durable solution to an over grown yard. 1/4 of an acre later, the grass is cut and my neighbors aren't disturbed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian G. Onieal

customer_reviews.title: Great eco mower
customer_reviews.text: Small bagger but great for a small yard. Honestly the easiest to use mower I’ve owned. Just don’t mess up the battery, they’re expensive to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: customer service and battery fizzle the same
customer_reviews.text: Would be a 4 star review, HOWEVER, the battery dies very quickly if the grass is even a little thick. I attempted to find a matching battery which I couldn't find an exact replacement so I reached to customer service to order a similar battery so I can swap if one dies in the middle of mowing, but they didn't write back. bottom line, unless you have a very very small yard, do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: James M Reed

customer_reviews.title: It works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I needed a mower that didn't take endless tugs to get started like a gas mower and didn't need an electrical cord that was difficult to maneuver in my large yard. This mower fit the bill. Allowed me to get my yard done quickly, and I won't mind using it regularly because it's easy.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: No more gas mowers hated putting gas smelling gas now I charge battery well it last for front yard I recommend another batter to cover backyard after cus it will only do front yard works great quiet n i love mine
customer_reviews.author: Minerva Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: quiet, you could run this one on a Saturday morning without waking the neighbors. starts with the push of a button every time. easy to get around. easy to change high of blades.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lawn mower, Great fallen leaves "harvester"
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mower, easy cutting height adjustment (one button). If you mow often with cuttings left the bag is not needed. Added function, on a lower cutting height (2) on driveways or pavement it chops up large leaves like maple and they take up much less volume in compost bin/bag space as the large & crinkled leaves no longer waste space.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick @ A2

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off in LOW level grass
customer_reviews.text: The mower runs well, in very low grass. When moving into medium high grass, it sounds like its about to shutoff, and it will, if you don't tilt the mower up. I have a decent size lawn, so I have to use both 40v batteries to finish the lawn. Will most likely move back to a gas mower. Is there anyway to increase the power?
customer_reviews.author: Aje4646

customer_reviews.title: Nice Concept.  Poor Execution.
customer_reviews.text: Good mower. Batteries suck. My battery didn’t last 20 minutes. The advertising says, ‘two hours charging’ but is deceptive because it’s the charge time not the actual use time. I don’t own an acre of land. I’m in a nice modular home community with a small grass footprint. Couldn’t get ahold of Greenworks. Thankfully I received a replacement battery from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge J.

customer_reviews.title: This worked perfectly and my little lawn was mowed in minutes.
customer_reviews.text: This lawnmower works great. I recently installed a sprinkler system and planted grass. I've got a pretty small lawn and was excited about using an electric mower and not worrying about gas. This worked perfectly and my little lawn was mowed in minutes. Now I've just got to construct a little shed to store this. The handle can fold, but I'm looking to just push it into a shed as is.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Harter

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: quiet, cuts really well and is light weight. i ordered an extra battery though so in case the first one dies before i'm done mowing, i have a 2nd to keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Mom Dutcher

customer_reviews.title: Endorse!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an electrical mower and stopped dancing the cord mambo. Battery enough power for my small yard with room to spar’. Liked it so much I bought a trimmer too.
customer_reviews.author: B. Minovi

customer_reviews.title: Awful unless you have a tiny yard with paper thin grass
customer_reviews.text: Awful. My grass is not that thick. In the beginning it took me three full batteries to finish my lawn which isn’t very large. Now I can’t go 10 feet without it stopping and I can’t finish my lawn on three full batteries. That’s on its highest height. Tried to save a few bucks. Should have returned it while I had the chance. Getting a gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great lawn mower. Starts right up, lightweight and no mixing gas! I was flustered the first day trying to figure out how to adjust the height, and the battery didn't last long the first time but no problems since
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Buy extra batteries... A lot of them.
customer_reviews.text: This lawn mower doesn't last longer than 1/10 acre before it dies. If you have more grass to cut than the strip beside a storefront sidewalk, keep scrolling. It takes three to four charges to cut my half acre lot, which has a good portion of it taken up by my house and driveway. I should have bought a 12 pack of batteries to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brie

customer_reviews.title: Good but need to get an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: Works great, super light weight. The only downside is the battery life isn’t long enough for my whole yard. If you have more than .25 acres then you should get two batteries
customer_reviews.author: Boss

customer_reviews.title: Pretty impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about a battery powered mower but I’ve used it for two months now and love it. Quiet, push a button to start and no obnoxious vibration or crappy new style fuel cans to mess with. My yard is a 1/4 acre minus buildings and a concrete driveway and this unit can cut it all on a single charge. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: N. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love this mower
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I love this mower. I own two homes and use this for one and the gas powered for the others. You don't realize how much vibration and fumes you get from a gas mower compared to this electric one. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love this lawnmower.
customer_reviews.text: Love my new lawnmower. Great even cut of the grass. Decent sized basket to catch the clippings and very easy to use. Battery is able to mow whole front yard ona single charge. Easy to push wish I had purchased it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: fiona campbell

customer_reviews.title: That it's light, battery run & compact.
customer_reviews.text: Really a great lawn mower for small yards. We cut the front lawn & the back with no issues & still have enough charge left.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Good bye electrical cord hello great looking lawn!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted to get away from the electrical cord. Cuts nice, bagging is efficient. Only negative is it is a bit difficult to change the cutting height. I would buy it again in a flash.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Davis

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 17-inch 40V Cordless Lawn Mower, 4.0 AH Battery Included
customer_reviews.text: We mostly had no problem assembling this mower. Thank goodness, Greenworks has a Customer Service number, so we called and they helped our family to understand how to install and use the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Best mower I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I like EVERYTHING on the mower, easy height adjust, easy push and even easier to charge and install battery. Make sure it is pushed in all of the way! Easy to clean and is perfect for a medium size hard. Holds a charge and makes a clean cut and shuts of IMMEDIATELY. Small and compact. Neill C.
customer_reviews.author: Neill C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this quiet and efficient mower!
customer_reviews.text: Bought to cut grass of varying heights, and have found it excellent ... easy to operate, not heavy to push around, and love the rechargeable battery that is can also be used on our pole saw by the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Mom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this mower it is super light and easy to pack down to our second story yard and it works really good if it is not cutting like it should just slow down while your walking I am so glad we bought this mower
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Tracker

customer_reviews.title: Great for small lawns...
customer_reviews.text: This unit works great on our very small lawn area. It takes less than 10 minutes to mow. The best part is not having to store gasoline for the mower. The only drawback I can see is that the mower lugs down even in only moderately thick grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: That's worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this machine a few weeks ago and it's the best investment work fantastic and best of all no more gas no more headache trying to star the lawnmower it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Eh, I’m going to return. It’s very easy to assemble and lightweight but it feels a bit cheap and the battery only lasted me about 40 mins. Then it was too hot to charge and needed to be cooled down for 30 mins, then charged again. It was only 80 out, no chance the battery makes it through those 95 degree days all summer. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: The only issue with this one is the battery life...it has died twice while trying to mow my lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: First use, stopped working - WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, battery was damaged. They sent a replacement. First use didn't even make it to my backyard, it turned off. Battery is charged. Don't even know what to do with it! Soooo upset!! :(
customer_reviews.author: Kris Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Lawnmower
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a couple of days, then died. We had to return it & purchased another brand.
customer_reviews.author: MSQUEEN

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: The mower works great as long as the grass isn’t too high. Need 2 batteries to do both front and back semi large yard.
customer_reviews.author: Qman7

customer_reviews.title: Great lawn mower
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and have St. Augustine grass. It is thick and spongy. I had a gas mower but it was heavy and bogged down in the spongy grass, mowing was a heavy chore. This electric mower is light and seems to float on the spongy grass. The thick carpet is no problem. I am able to cut my whole yard in one charge. Pushing it around the yard is a breeze. So far this mower is great.
customer_reviews.author: leeannske

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my daughter.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a small yard and her 22" gas mower kicked the bucket. We love everything about this mower except the battery life is about a 1/2 hour. Luckily we can hustle and get the whole lawn done in less than a 1/2 hour. I suggest getting a second battery to ensure you can finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T. Maciulewicz

customer_reviews.title: Lighter weight
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very happy with this mower. The problem I had initially was tightening the black clips on handle too tight. It wouldn't allow me to fold the handle. Just need to leave them a little loose. The mower cut my grass cleanly and evenly and was very easy to maneuver. I was paying $70 a month for mowing....this will pay for itself in one season. And, it folds up and stands on end taking up little space. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: EmGrace

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a small yard and this lawn mower with one charge cut the lawn. Its a great product
customer_reviews.author: Erick cordero

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Love the mower works great easy to use. Battery doesn’t last too long though especially in the heat. So will be buying a second one soon. But love that my trimmer and tiller work with the same battery. Buying the blower soon as well. All in all a fantastic product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Woods

customer_reviews.title: Nice mower
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this mower weekly for about a month. It seems to mow pretty well. Easy to maneuver. The mulching capability is pretty poor in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Wilson

product_meta.title: Greenworks G-MAX 40V 17'' Brushed Mower with 4Ah Battery and Charger - 2508302 model
product_meta.description: Size:17-Inch| Style:4Ah Battery and ChargerCordless outdoor power equipment is ideal for homeowners like you who are simplifying and focusing on what’s essential to getting the most out of life. The Greenworks GMAX 40V family of tools are built with medium weight construction and high-efficiency motors. The universal 40V battery system powers more than 25 products and provides gas-like performance with ample running time for normal yard projects. Of high-quality manufacturing, these products are easy to start and lighter weight than the gas products you’re used to, making your day of yard work a whole lot easier.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Greenworks G-MAX 40V 17'' Brushed Pull Mower, 2508302 model with 4Ah Battery and Charger
Lawn Mower dimensions – 52.05” L x 19.21” W x 41” H | Battery Capacity – 4Ah | Battery Life – Approx. 2000 charge cycles | Wheels size – 7” and 8” | Cutting width – 17”
2-in-1 feature offers rear bagging and mulching capability for multiple use
The unit is made of high quality durable plastic, which allows it to be light in weight and easy to maneuver
Single lever 5-position height adjustment offers cutting height range from 1-1/4 inch to 3-3/8-inch for the best cut in all environments

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,010 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
